intro: Rosa rubiginosa f. lactea, commonly known as the white-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a rare and distinctive variant of the common dog rose. It is characterized by its pale pink to white flowers, which bloom in early summer. The plant features thorny stems and serrated, dark green leaves. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in perfumery.
